thread.title: UK sees record demand for 2065 gilt syndication
thread.title_full: UK sees record demand for 2065 gilt syndication

title: UK sees record demand for 2065 gilt syndication
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Tue, Oct 20, 2015, 13:33 BST - UK Markets close in 2 hrs 57 mins UK sees record demand for 2065 gilt syndication Reuters - UK Focus â€“ 20 minutes ago 0.00 
(Updates with quote and market reaction) 
LONDON, Oct (HKSE: 3366-OL.HK - news ) 20 (Reuters) - A sale of 50-year British government debt drew record demand on Tuesday, with a bookrunner saying investors had placed orders for more than 21.8 billion pounds ($33.7 billion). 
The bond was sold at 1.5 basis points above the 2068 gilt and the deal size was fixed at 4.75 billion pounds, the bookrunner said. 
The scale of demand was the strongest since a previous record 16.5 billion pounds of orders at a syndication in 2014. 
The strong appetite for the bond comes as long-dated British government debt -- which is typically bought by pension funds -- has underperformed U.S (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) . Treasuries and German government bonds since September, particularly in the run-up to the syndication. 
"The demand is pretty strong. We were sort of expecting that because the sector had cheapened quite a lot and there are plenty of reasons why one should be involved at the long end of the curve," said Vatsala Datta, UK rate strategist at RBC (Other OTC: RBCI - news ) . 
"By any measure, this is a pretty big book size and unsurprisingly the DMO (Debt Management Office) has upped the target as well." 
The syndication needed to raise around 4.5 billion pounds to meet the debt agency's target for conventional bond issuance via syndication for the 2015/16 financial year. 
The bookrunners on the deal are BofA Merrill Lynch, JPMorgan, RBS (LSE: RBS.L - news ) and Santander. 
($1 = 0.6456 pounds) (Reporting by Ana Nicolaci da Costa; editing by William Schomberg)
